description: Ms. codex. Title from text 2, fol. 7a. Physical description: Varying lines per page; written in naskh and shikastah in black by different hands on glazed, laid European paper. Rubrication and catchwords. Text 6 and part of text 2 vocalized. Fol. 2a-6b, 83a-85a, 88a-89b blank. Some damp staining, insect damage; a few paper repairs. Lower outer left corner of fol. 1-12 torn away, but text unaffected. Origin: Text 2 completed at the beginning of Rabīʻ I 1018 H [June 1609], in Kostantaniye by Ali bin Hasan (fol. 26a). Text 6 completed on 29 Shawwāl 1094 H [21 October 1683] (fol. 87a).
abstract: Collection of Turkish and Arabic religious texts.
contents: 2. fol. 7a-26a: Hâzâ Kitab-ı itikad. Mesail concerning Sunni doctrine.
6. fol. 85b-87a: Vird-i Seyyit Yahya Efendi meşayih-i Halvetiye. Yahya Şirvani's Wird al-Sattār; in Arabic.
7. fol. 87b: [Short wird in Arabic and notes].
extent: 89 leaves : paper ; 206 x 134 mm bound to 206 x 141 mm
subject: Fatwas—Early works to 1800
binding_note: Quarter leather with flap; marlbed paper covers over boards; pink paper doublures.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
